title: Monsoon Update - Very Heavy Rain, thunderstorms & Snowfall Warning in 13 States Over next 3 Days - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Update: Along with the mild cold, the Weather across the country is also experiencing rapid changes. The changing Weather is also affecting people’s health. Meanwhile, a new western disturbance will affect the western Himalayan region from November 4th, potentially leading to snowfall in the hilly states. The India Meteorological Department has issued an alert for heavy rains between November 3rd, 4th, and 5th. The Meteorological Department predicts that several states across the country may experience heavy to heavy rainfall, including Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Bihar, and Gujarat.

Heavy Rain in Several States
According to the IMD, a thunderstorm warning has been issued for Gujarat, Marathwada, and parts of Maharashtra from November 3rd to 5th. Meanwhile, heavy rains are expected in northeastern India’s Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura on November 3rd. Additionally, a western disturbance may cause thunderstorms and strong winds in Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand starting November 4th. According to the Meteorological Department, light to moderate rain is expected in northwest India, including Uttarakhand, on November 4th, 5th, and 6th.

Weather Conditions in Delhi-NCR
According to the Meteorological Department, the Weather in Delhi is expected to remain clear or partly cloudy until November 5th. There will be light fog and smog during the night and morning.

Weather Conditions in Uttar Pradesh

The impact of Cyclonic Storm ‘Montha’ is evident in Uttar Pradesh. Eastern Uttar Pradesh, including Ballia, Ghazipur, Mau, Azamgarh, and Varanasi, has been experiencing intermittent heavy rain for the past two days. According to the Meteorological Department, rain is likely in eastern Uttar Pradesh, including Ballia, Ghazipur, Azamgarh, Mau, Varanasi, Sonbhadra, Mirzapur, Deoria, Gorakhpur, Sant Kabir Nagar, Basti, Kushinagar, Maharajganj, Siddharthnagar, and Ambedkar Nagar.

Bihar Weather Forecast
According to the IMD, the Weather will remain normal for the next 3-4 days. No heavy rain is currently forecast. Light fog or mist is possible in the morning and late evening.

 Himachal today Weather
According to the IMD, a new western disturbance will activate in Himachal Pradesh, leading to snowfall in Kullu, Kinnaur, and Lahaul-Spiti, and rain in the lower areas of Shimla, Solan, and Mandi.
